feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition
feed.subtitle: SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone Free Sevice Plan limit reached
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community, 

Following with the restriction known of SAP Build Work Zone free tier service, 3434634 - SAP Build Work Zone Free Sevice Plan limit reached

I've only assigned Laundpad_Admin role to one user, which is my id. But during this month, i login to Designtime site, I received limit reached page. I'm puzzled why only one admin is assigned in my subaccount but i received the limitation. 

Anyone know is there application log on checking who are the user accessing Work Zone as an admin from BTP subaccount usage?

 

Regards,

Ben

entry.title: HTML5 not visible in the BWZ
entry.content:
Hello everyone!

I am trying to deploy this template app from the SAP documentation through Cloud Foundry:
build-workzone-integration/standard/html5-content-provider-sample/ManageProducts at main Â· SAP-samples/build-workzone-integration

and after building the mta.yaml and deplying the .mtar archive, it does not appear in the Build Work Zone, standard edition. 

I have modified the Destinations accordingly, and they appear in the cocktpit > Destinations. The app itself also appears in the cockpit > HTML5 Applications, and it runs smoothly. 

Yet, nothing appears in the Build work zone Content manager, or in the Content provider, even after a refresh.

I have noticed that I could add a new content provider, using the two Destinations generated during deployment, and that makes a role available, but no App, no catalog, and no group, as defined in the cdm.json. This content provider is thus not really useful, and anyway it defeats the purpose of deploying the app and its content through GACD. 


Has there been any changes in the objects that can be deployed with the cdm? The last modifications in the repo are 10 months old so it's possible, but I can't find anything about that in the documentation or the blog.

I've been stuck on this issue for the better part of the week, and while I think I have made some progresses, I'm still at loss about the root of the issue.

Thanks a lot for your guidance!

entry.title: SAP build work zone, standard edition
entry.content:
Hello experts, 

I am unable to access SAP build work zone, standard edition in my subaccount AWS east (VA), but i can access it in AZURE.

entry.title: On-premises S/4 app exposed to SAP Build Work Zone, but not showing up
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I followed the steps from the official guide to publish an on-premise S/4HANA application to SAP Build Work Zone. The tile appears correctly in the Work Zone, but when I click on it, I get the error message:
"No suitable resource found", and the app does not launch.

Has anyone encountered this issue before?
What configuration or setting should I check to make the app display properly?

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Best regards,

Exposing On-Premise S/4 Apps to SAP Build Work Zon... - SAP Community

entry.title: Myinbox in Work Zone return internal server error 500
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

we have enabled Fiori application MyInbox into BTP Work Zone using content provider from our onpremise S4HANA as well as propagated required user roles, however when we open the Myinbox tile, we got "Internal server error 500".

 

Interesting is, that we can actually see the number of tasks inside myinbox correctly in preview of tile, so it's gathering the data correctly.

The browser tracing show nothing more than this:

We've checked all logs from following areas - cloud connector, ICM, gateway logs, sm21, st22, su53, all dev_* traces, srt_util, /iwfnd/TRACES, certificates, Work Zone logs ... = nothing.

What is not clear to me, is in Gateway logs - I can see GET on count of items in my inbox, but then nothing else. No error nor success, even I open myinbox in same time.

We've also checked and did various combinations of role assignment, configured Cloud Identity Services, cyphers, system resources.... nothing helped.

Odata activated and My Inbox configured according to this SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library

Just for the record, the myinbox accessed from onprem Fiori works as expected - using the same user.

Any idea?

Thanks a lot,

Miro

entry.title: Joule does not execute transactional capacity.
entry.content:
A few days ago, I provisioned and implemented Joule in my environment, it even suggested some example prompts and if I sent it 'Show me the purchase orders', it would show me. However, suddenly it stopped executing these features, saying it cannot connect to my system.All destinations are correct, the identity propagation is as well, the services are active, and the user has permission; I have no idea what it could be



 

 

...

entry.title: How to add a Shell Plugin on SAP Build Work Zone Standard Edition
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm currently working on a project using SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition and I would like to add a Shell Plugin to customize the footer

I have gone through the official documentation, but I still have a few questions:

  1. Is it possible to use Shell Plugins in Standard Edition, or is it limited to Advanced Edition only?

  2. If yes, is there any step-by-step guide or sample project available for the Standard Edition?

  3. How can I properly register the Shell Plugin in the Work Zone environment after deployment (via HTML5 apps or Content Provider)?

Any help or shared experience would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

Best regards,
Giang

entry.title: SAP work zone site tile is not loading in i-frames when clicked second time after opening one tile.
entry.content:
2025-07-17 09:48:01.663500 App-defined navigation mode is not valid! - Fallback to URL Template's capability sap.ushell.ApplicationType

Issue replication: 

01) configured Fiori tiles My Inbox, Manage sales order, Manage sales order.

02) open sap work zone site and click on My Inbox tile OPENS.
03) Nav back to home page click on any tile app is not loading. - miss match in iframe container parent id
04) each time need to refresh home page to open\navigate on click on tile.

tiles, catalog, spaces are exposed from backend system.

Tried changing sap ui5 version from site URL sap-ui-version=****

Authentication we are using user id and password  to backend

change in iframe container parent id when navigate back and trued to click on another tile.

entry.title: What has happened to Workzone page layouts with the latest release??!!
entry.content:
The latest Workzone release now accommodates an 8 column wide grid (previously 6 was the max) and the overall page max-width has increased. It also behaves differently than before with varying screen width: previously there were fixed dimensions at different break points. Now is scales elastically.

What this means is now my entire site, built on a 6 column grid with the old max-width just looks terrible.

I am super unhappy about this.

I can't believe SAP has made this change unilaterally with no way to flip back. The balance and proportions that I've been working with months are now wrong with two weeks before launch. It's a huge disrespect. Frowny emoticon to SAP.

entry.title: Request for Guidance on Notification Navigation in SAP Build Work Zone
entry.content:
Hello expert,

I have a process as shown in the picture.

I want the process to send a notification to Work Zone after I complete the approval step. When I click on that notification, it should navigate to the app I configured. 

And currently, Iâm able to send a notification to Work Zone after the approval step is completed, as shown in the screenshot below

Now, I would like to implement the navigation behavior when clicking on the notification. Could you please guide me on how to achieve this? 

I sincerely appreciate your kind guidance and continued support. Thank you very much!

Best regards,

Giang

entry.title: UI Integration Card Error while accessing in SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

I have developed a UI Imtegration Card in BAS (Using the template UI Integration Card and able to do the preview there as it is getting data from Odata Service. PFA the preview for same.

After adding that Card in the Build Work Zone, Standard Edition it is giving error below error:

Destination "ecqrtcard" could not be resolved.

No technical destination found. Content Channel ID: "ovps". Please contact your administrator.

PFA the error screen shot along with destination configuration.

 

In BAS preview it is working means it is getting data from odata using the destination but in build work zone it is giving destinaiton error.

 

Please suggest what can be the issue.

entry.title: My Inbox Fiori App in Work Zone standard edition handle task from different systems?
entry.content:
Can My Inbox Fiori App (com.sap.spa.inbox) in Work Zone standard edition simultaneously list and display workflow task from different systems?

We have S/4HANA on Private Cloud and SAP CAR as backend systems, and I want the My Inbox Fiori App in Work Zone standard edition to display workflow tasks from these as well as the tasks generated by workflows developed in SAP Build Process Automation and deployed to Cloud Foundry.

We are not considering SAP Task Center at the moment.

entry.title: BUILD Work Zone - HTML5 Business Solutions vs HTML5 apps using saas_approuter
entry.content:
I just came across the idea of HTML5 Business Solutions in SAP Work Zone.

Developing HTML5 Business Solutions as Content Providers | SAP Help Portal

Federation of HTML5 Business Solutions | SAP Help Portal

Checking the use cases, it feels that this is target for partner apps when it comes to multitenancy. However there is the possibility to create single tenant apps. 

Based on that I have a few general questions: 

1) Is it possible to create a single tenant solution containing only the front end part of an app? (similar to a HTML5 app using saas_approuter)? If yes, what would be the advantages/main differences on doing so? Any sample repositories are appreciated.

2) A bit of futurology, is it possible that HTML5 apps created using saas_approuter will be deprecated in favor of HTML5 Business Solutions? I ask that mainly after Roadmap item "Automatic content refresh for integrated HTML5 applications after update" not targeting saas_approuter but only Business Solutions

If anyone from SAP can explain what was the concept behind Business Solutions, specially a single tenant scenario are very appreciated. Are such apps internally handled differently? Is there any relevant difference on the managed router of such scenarios?

Thanks in advance,

entry.title: Can We Bring âImport Financial Dataâ to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud? -Workflow Integration
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We have implemented a Project Budget Approval Enhancement in SAP Public Cloud leveraging SAP BTP services. As part of this solution, we created the Import Financial Data app within SAP Work Zone to trigger the budget approval workflow. Once the workflow is triggered, the data is seamlessly transferred to the SAP Public Cloud.

We would like to know if there is a way to replicate the Import Financial Data app directly within SAP Public Cloud, since the current app is only available in SAP Work Zone.

entry.title: SAP Workzone Local Entry Point stopped working
entry.content:
Issue Summary
On Thursday, 24/07/2025, both CEP and LEP services stopped working for our team.

  • CEP services: Resumed functioning sometime this week.

  • LEP services: Still not working as expected.

Current Behavior

  • The LEP site loads, we can see the Catalog and launch apps via  Classic App finder.

  • However, no Spaces or Workpages are visible or accessible.

  • Attempted GraphQL calls from Workzone targeting the menus (spaces/workpages) for LEP (siteId: "default") fail.

Technical Details

mymtxapp-approuter.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/cp.portal/cep/content/v1?query=%7Bmenu(siteId%3A%22default%22)%7D 

{
  "errors": [
    {
      "message": "You are not authorized to access this resource or the site does not contain the needed roles",
      "path": [
        "menu"
      ],
      "extensions": {
        "statusCode": "FORBIDDEN_ERROR"
      }
    }
  ],
  "data": null

This error is a bit misleading as there is only one role collection and it is working cause we can see the catalog

nothing has changed, i even tried the running https://github.com/cap-js/incidents-app/blob/saas-lep/workzone/cdm.json and no cigar

Request

  • Could someone please advise on next steps to resolve the issue with LEP so Spaces and Workpages show up again?

@SAPSupport @IrisSasson @FabianBerr @rupambhatta

entry.title: Migrate BW Content from SAP EP to BTP Build Work Zone
entry.content:
Hi All,

We are migrating our SAP Enterprise Portal (On Premise) System to SAP BTP Build Work Zone by creating the content in the Build Work Zone. Please note, there is no Content Federation from portal to work zone.

 

I am able to create new application for WDA, Transaction Code, UI5, URL iView in work zone but for BW Report there is no option in the Build Work Zone.

 

Please let me know how we can create app in work zone and configure the BW Reports in Build Work Zone without content federation.

 

Regards,

Rohit Gera

entry.title: Not able to fetch routing args in onRouteMatched() from semantic object and navigation from Workzone
entry.content:
Greeting Experts,

I am trying to develop UI5 app where First page routing parameter will come from SAP Build Work zone, standard edition application navigation parameters. But when I am defining route patterns in manifest.json file for first page It is showing blank on output screen. Here is code for manifest.json.

 "routes": [
        {
          "name": "RouteDashboard",
          "pattern": "Employee/{role}",
          "target": [
            "TargetDashboard"
          ]
        }

  In workzone, standard edition I am giving navigation parameters like this.                                                           

Dashboard controller:- 

Can anybody help me on this, while passing parameter in manifest file I am not able to see anything and if I remove this I can see the output of app but can't fetch argument from onRouteMatched in this case. Any help would be appreciated.

entry.title: SSO Configuration Issue When Accessing S/4HANA Public Cloud content via SAP Build Work Zone
entry.content:
Hello,

I am trying to display a S/4HANA public cloud application in SAP Build Work Zone. I followed the tutorial below and was able to successfully display the app:

ð https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-build-work-zone-integrate-sap-s-4hana-public-cloud-content-to-sap/ba-p/13572886

 

However, I encountered an issue:
If I am already logged into the Public Cloud or Cloud Identity Services, clicking the tile opens the app correctly.
But if I am not logged in, clicking the tile shows the following error message:
âThis domain is not authenticated. Please contact your system administrator.â

 

I would like to achieve SSO (Single Sign-On) so that logging into Build Work Zone alone allows access to the Public Cloud app.
Is this not possible?
If it is possible, how can I configure it?

In the tutorial, I set the destination for N5T_Starter_rt_apps to No Authentication â could this be causing the issue?

entry.title: Work Zone: text widgets in a single row, height no longer aligns
entry.content:
Work Zone has once again unilaterally changed the way it behaves with the result of messing up my design.

Until this morning (13 Aug 25) when adding text widgets to a single row (a freestyle section with multiple columns), text widgets were presented as the same height, regardless of how much text was in each.

See example, below: each of the three elements has a different amount of text (2 lines, 3 lines, 1 line), but the white boxes all displayed with the same height as the largest box.

Perfect - a nice balanced design.

Now here's what it looks like:

The text widget height is controlled by the amount of text in each widget. My design looks like a row of wonky teeth. Thanks SAP.

So what has happened and why? When are we going to get consulted or at the very least notified in advance of these sorts of changes? See my other posts for other rants about SAP changing the front end unilaterally. 

Honestly SAP, you are consistently disappointing. If you expect us to promote your product in any way you need to get better at this.

entry.title: Fallback method for opening web applications in iframe if loading fails
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am trying to implement a fallback mechanism for opening a web application inside an iframe. If the app fails to load in the iframe, I want to automatically open it in a new browser tab.

Hereâs are the implementations that I have tried so far, I am providing a brute code of the methods that I have tried implementing:

onTilePress: function (oEvent) {
    var sUrl = oEvent.getSource().getBindingContext("appModel").getProperty("url");
    var oFrame = this.byId("appFrame");

    // attachAfterRendering for iframe handling
    oFrame.attachAfterRendering({ url: sUrl }, function (oEvent, oData) {
        var iframe = document.querySelector("iframe");

        if (!iframe) {
            console.error("Iframe not found");
            return;
        }

        // Listen for load success/failure
        iframe.onload = function () {
            console.log("App loaded successfully in iframe");
        };

        iframe.onerror = function () {
            console.error("Error loading app in iframe, opening in new tab");
            window.open(oData.url, "_blank");
        };

        // Safety fallback - message event listener
        window.addEventListener("message", function (e) {
            console.log("Message received from origin:", e.origin);
            // Expected origin is from embedded app, but I only get the portal origin here
        });

        // Detach afterrendering after execution
        oFrame.detachAfterRendering();
    });
}

 

Challenges I am facing:

  1. iframe.onload and iframe.onerror are never triggered â not even for successful apps.

  2. onAfterRendering only detects the UI5 HTML control render, not the internal iframe load state.

  3. When listening for postMessage, I get the custom portal origin (e.g., https://port8081-workspaces...) instead of the embedded appâs origin, so I cannot distinguish failures correctly.


    Can someone please help me to find a correct way to detect if an app inside an iframe has failed to load in SAP UI5 (so that I can implement a proper fallback to open it in a new tab)?
    Also suggest if is there a recommended UI5 mechanism to achieve this?

    Thanks in advance,
    Sai Krishna.
